While credited as a Tom and Jerry cartoon, this is not the cat-and-mouse team but an earlier Mutt-and-Jeff rip-off featuring them going about to survive in today's turbulent economy. In the end, Tom and Jerry, being much better equipped to deal with matters of life and death, pay a visit and rescue Mutt and Jeff. Only Alan Gordon makes an unexpected cameo in this one cut.
Title: Tom and Jerry Clawing Ideas (1959)

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie is pale by comparison to more recent Disney fairy tales, thanks to computer graphics. The biggest mistake to my point of view is a pretty traditional one, with one character good, one character bad, without enough nuances. I enjoy the story with multiple characters and equal chances of becoming heroes and being severely punished.
